2022-05-01.name: Milwaukee Film Festival
2022-05-01.summary: Watch more than 200 films from around the globe, based at the 1927 Oriental Theatre on the East Side. Virtual passes also are available for home screening.

2022-05-01.name: Art Attack
2022-05-01.summary: On the eastern shore of Lake Michigan, the eight towns between Michiana and Sawyer hold artist demonstrations, workshops and gallery receptions.

2022-05-01.name: International Festival of Owls
2022-05-01.summary: This southeast Minnesota town offers owl prowls, hooting contests, pellet dissection, live-owl programs and children's activities.

2022-05-01.name: Maifest
2022-05-01.summary: There's a lot going on in this former communal society in eastern Iowa â€” a 10 a.m. Saturday parade, polka music, keg-tapping, food-sampling, artisan demonstrations and pony rides.

2022-05-01.name: U.S. Grant's Birthday
2022-05-01.summary: The former home of the Civil War general and president celebrates his 200th birthday with free admission to the Grant Museum, Main Street walking tours with Gen. Grant, a pie auction, a spy trial and cake.

2022-05-01.name: Homegrown Music Festival
2022-05-01.summary: More than 100 musical acts perform in venues around the Twin Ports, and there also will be film, visual arts and craft beer.

2022-05-05.summary: This big Dutch heritage fest features daily historical tours, a craft market and afternoon and evening parades.

2022-05-06.name: Spring Festival & Folk Fest
2022-05-06.summary: This Kickapoo Valley village in southwest Wisconsin offers a rodeo, tractor pull, Maypole dancing and a Saturday-night folk concert.

2022-05-06.name: Horicon Marsh Bird Festival
2022-05-06.summary: This large festival in east-central Wisconsin is around a large marsh often called the Everglades of the North. There are bird hikes, bird-banding demonstrations, pontoon-boat tours, canoe and kayak tours, bus tours and a round-the-clock Big Sit, in which participants try to identify as many birds as possible. Register early for field trips.

2022-05-06.name: Mushroom Festival
2022-05-06.summary: This northwest Michigan town is morel central in May, celebrating the spring hunt with a carnival, carriage rides, flea market, duck races and a parade at noon Saturday.

2022-05-06.summary: Visit artists at 28 studios and sites in and around St. Croix Falls, Osceola and Amery.

2022-05-06.summary: This big Dutch heritage fest features daily historical tours, a craft market and afternoon and evening parades.

2022-05-06.name: Fulton Dutch Days
2022-05-06.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates its Dutch heritage with folk dancing, windmill tours, an arts and crafts show, heritage demonstrations and a parade at 3 p.m. Saturday.

2022-05-13.name: Syttende Mai
2022-05-13.summary: The festival in this town south of Madison, which celebrates Norwegian constitution day, is the largest in North America and probably the world. It features Norwegian dancing, Viking games, fjord horses, a canoe race, an arts fair and a big parade at 1:30 p.m. Sunday.

2022-05-13.name: Syttende Mai
2022-05-13.summary: In Minnesota, Norwegians settled first in this town in bluff country. There's Norwegian food, music and dance, and a big parade at noon Saturday.

2022-05-13.name: Art-A-Whirl Studio Tour
2022-05-13.summary: Up to 1,000 artists are taking part in this tour of studios in the northeast Minneapolis arts district.

2022-05-14.name: Morel Mushroom Festival
2022-05-14.summary: This town along the Wisconsin River calls itself the Morel Mushroom Capital of Wisconsin. There's a 3 p.m. parade and fireworks plus a flea market, arts fair and pedal-tractor pull.

2022-05-14.name: National Morel Mushroom Festival
2022-05-14.summary: This town on the east end of Lake Charlevoix celebrates the season with an arts and crafts show, carnival, morel seminars, chef-prepared morsels at Taste of Morels and a Saturday-evening concert.

2022-05-14.name: Syttende Mai
2022-05-14.summary: This Norwegian town, southeast of La Crosse, holds a bicycle tour, troll hunt, rommegrot-eating contest, old-time music, children's tractor pull and a big parade.

2022-05-14.name: Cinco de Mayo
2022-05-14.summary: This southwest Wisconsin town celebrates with pinatas, mariachi music, a soccer tournament and children's activities at City Field and Riverside Park.

2022-05-15.name: Tulip Time

2022-05-15.name: Syttende Mai
2022-05-15.summary: This Norwegian town, southeast of La Crosse, holds a bicycle tour, troll hunt, rommegrot-eating contest, old-time music, children's tractor pull and a big parade.

2022-05-21.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2022-05-21.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 81st birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.

2022-05-21.name: Civil War Living History Festival
2022-05-21.summary: In this town near Janesville, this free festival is at the Milton House Museum, once a stop on the Underground Railroad. It features an encampment of soldiers, military drills, cannon firing and an historic walking tour. Sign up in advance for living-history tours of the hotel, where guests will go back to 1861 and meet a freedom-seeker hidden in the cellar.

2022-05-21.name: Tulip Festival
2022-05-21.summary: The popular festival in this Dutch town in northwest Iowa celebrates its 81st anniversary with dance, music, street scrubbing and parades at 2:15 and 6 p.m. daily.

2022-05-21.name: Festival of Birds
2022-05-21.summary: This festival in northwest Minnesota is near the convergence of prairie with northern pine forest and eastern hardwood forest. Space in field trips to local refuges fills quickly.

2022-05-21.name: Chequamegon Bay Birding & Nature Festival
2022-05-21.summary: Based out of the Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center, activities include bird-banding, hikes and expeditions, hatchery tours and kayaking tours of estuaries.

2022-05-21.name: Trout Days
2022-05-21.summary: This town on the Harmony-Preston Valley State Trail celebrates spring with a car show, kids' pedal pull, live music, fireworks and a parade on Saturday.

2022-05-21.name: Rummage Along the River
2022-05-21.summary: Seventy miles of garage sales will line the Wisconsin side of the Mississippi River from Stoddard, just south of La Crosse, to Lynxville and Mount Sterling.

2022-05-22.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2022-05-22.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 81st birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.

It features an encampment of soldiers, military drills, cannon firing and an historic walking tour. Sign up in advance for living-history tours of the hotel, where guests will go back to 1861 and meet a freedom-seeker hidden in the cellar.

2022-05-22.name: Des Plaines River Canoe & Kayak Marathon
2022-05-22.summary: This 18.5-mile race and tour through forest preserves to Mount Prospect is for families and first-timers as well as competitors. There's also a 5.25-mile Minithon, and boats can be rented.

2022-05-23.name: Duluth Dylan Festival
2022-05-23.summary: The town in which Bob Dylan was born celebrates the singer's 81st birthday with a Blood on the  Tracks train ride, a singer-songwriter  contest, a bus tour, films, music and a trivia contest.

2022-05-26.name: North Iowa Band Festival
2022-05-26.summary: There's a carnival, craft show and car cruise, but don't miss the 10 a.m. Saturday band parade in this northern Iowa town, which Meredith Willson made famous in "The Music Man.''

2022-05-27.name: Duluth Dylan Festival

2022-05-27.name: World's Largest Brat Fest
2022-05-27.summary: There's music on four stages, plus kids' games, a sports zone, carnival rides and Sunday fireworks. Headliners include Smash Mouth. Admission is free.  Outside the Alliant Energy Center.

2022-05-27.name: Sound Cheq Music Fest
2022-05-27.summary: Thirty local bands, choirs and orchestras perform at three venues in this town on Chequamegon Bay.

2022-05-27.name: CelebrAsian Asian Heritage Festival
2022-05-27.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features such activities as martial arts, lion dancers,  chopstick races, a fashion show and, of course, food.

2022-05-28.name: Duluth Dylan Festival

2022-05-28.name: Chicago Suenos Festival
2022-05-28.summary: This first-time Latin-music festival in Grant Park also features Latin food, art installations and a Ferris wheel. It's not free.

2022-05-28.summary: This free pageant  at Colonial Michilimackinac features a cast of more than 400, re-enacting  events that took place between the French, British and Indian tribes on June 2, 1763.
